xxl.core.pipes.memoryManager
Class AbstractStrategy

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.pipes.memoryManager.AbstractStrategy
All Implemented Interfaces:
Strategy
Direct Known Subclasses:
UniformStrategy
public abstract class AbstractStrategy
extends Object
implements Strategy

This abstract class is the superclass for each kind of strategy for memory distribution. This class manages registration and deregistration of memory-using objects and it ensures that the total memory usage never exceeds the total amount of available memory. Implementors have only to specify how to handle an overflow.

Since:
1.1

requestForMemory

public void requestForMemory(MemoryMonitorable memUser,
                             int newMemSize)
Receives a request for an amount of memory from a memory-using object. This method directly assigns the desired amount of memory to the requesting object and checks whether a memory overflow has occured. If so, it calls the handleOverflow-method.

Specified by:
requestForMemory in interface Strategy
Parameters:
memUser - the requesting memory-using object.
newMemSize - the desired amount of memory (in bytes).

assignMemSize

public void assignMemSize(MemoryManageable memUser,
                          int newMemSize)
Assigns a special amount of memory to the specified memory-using object. If this assignment causes a memory overflow, the handleOverflow-method is not called, because the implementor of the handleOverflow-method shall be able to solve a memory overflow caused by a call of the setGlobalMemSize-method gradually (object by object). This technique would possibly result in an endless recursion, if this method would call the handleOverflow-method each time an overflow occurs. That's why it does not. So, in this case the caller of this method is responsible therefor that his assignments will finally lead to an overflow-free state.

Specified by:
assignMemSize in interface Strategy
Parameters:
memUser - the memory-using object as the recipient of the assignment.
newMemSize - The amount of memory to be assigned (in bytes).

detectOverflow

public boolean detectOverflow()
Detects wheather a memory overflow has occured or not.

Specified by:
detectOverflow in interface Strategy
Returns:
Returns true if an overflow has occured.

handleOverflow

public abstract void handleOverflow()
This method handles a memory overflow (i.e., it has to solve it). The implementor specifies in this method the way of distribution of memory among the memory-using objects.

Specified by:
handleOverflow in interface Strategy
